One of the objectives of the project is to use only Free Software tools as possible, since this is a community project does not make sense to share information and use proprietary tools, we want that everyone can use this tools, be able to hack Bicycle LED Pov :-)

=Schematic and PCB design=
There are at least two good candidates, [http://geda.seul.org/index.html gEDA] and [http://kicad.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Main_Page KiCad] - both are availably in GNU/Linux Ubuntu repositories.

I use KiCad because looks like to me more user friendly.

=Firmware=
==C compiler==
The C compiler is the [http://www.avrfreaks.net/wiki/index.php/Documentation:AVR_GCC AVR-GCC], which is stimulated from Atmel :-)

One of the main reasons to use the Atmel MCUs is because there are very good tools as the AVR-GCC and AVR-LibC freely - both are availably in GNU/Linux Ubuntu repositories. Also Atmel provides good documentation, good example codes and a strong community :-)

==USB Library==
I started by reading about [http://www.atmel.com/dyn/resources/prod_documents/AVR_USB_Software.htm Atmel USB Software Library for AT90USBxxx Microcontrollers] but I ended up by choosing the [http://www.fourwalledcubicle.com/wiki/Wikka/MyUSB Dean Camera's MyUSB library].

==IDE==
I use Anjuta or Quanta Plus, hoever, any text editor should be ok.
